name: Gabriel García Márquez
biography: Nobel Prize-winning author, known for 'One Hundred Years of Solitude'. Master of magical realism.

name: Jane Austen
biography: 19th-century novelist celebrated for 'Pride and Prejudice' and social commentary on class.

name: Haruki Murakami
biography: Contemporary novelist blending surrealism and pop culture in works like 'Norwegian Wood'.

name: Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie
biography: Renowned for novels like 'Half of a Yellow Sun' and her advocacy for feminism and equality.

name: Ernest Hemingway
biography: American novelist known for his terse prose and classics like 'The Old Man and the Sea'.

name: Isabel Allende
biography: Writer of 'The House of the Spirits', blending magical realism with historical and political themes.

name: Leo Tolstoy
biography: One of the greatest novelists, author of 'War and Peace' and 'Anna Karenina'.

name: Margaret Atwood
biography: Author of 'The Handmaid’s Tale', exploring dystopia, power, and gender politics.

name: Franz Kafka
biography: Modernist writer whose works like 'The Metamorphosis' explore alienation and absurdity.

name: Virginia Woolf
biography: Modernist author of 'Mrs Dalloway', pioneer in stream-of-consciousness narrative style.
